predicate.note: Frames file for 'educate' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry.

example.name: just transitive
example.text: They feel the need from time to time *trace* to `educate' me.''

example.name: sentential subject (by which I mean object)
example.text: Still, says Mr. Lee: ``We need *trace* to educate people that they need to get to a phone somehow, some way, to let someone know what their status is.''
example.arg: they need to get to a phone somehow, some way, to let someone know what their status is

example.name: prepositional subject
example.text: If the media decide *trace* to work harder at *trace* educating the public about these complex and technical issues, that hardly can be termed non-objective journalism.

example.name: adjectival!!!!
example.text: But the kids with highly educated parents did 68% less housework than those in less-educated families.
